chapter.title: Known Issues and Caveats
chapter.subtitle: Known Problems And Workarounds In This Release
chapter.para: Here is the list of known issues in this release of OpenNMS.

sect1.title: HTTP services may show false outages on upgrade
sect1.para: Prior to 0.9.9, the HTTP service would be discovered if there was an httpd process listening on ports 80, 8000, or 8080. However, if the was a device with two or more httpd processes running, say on both 80 and 8080, and one died, as long as the other one was up no event would be generated. To address this, there are now three separate default services defined: HTTP (on port 80), HTTP-8000 (on port 8000) and HTTP-8080 (on port 8080 - natch).

During an upgrade from previous versions to 0.9.9 or higher, note that devices which had no HTTP server on port 80 but one on another port will now show that their HTTP service is lost. It can either be unmanaged or it will be automatically deleted after five days by default.

sect1.title: Reporting now sends an e-mail
sect1.para: Rather than tying up the Web UI for a long period of time, Availability reports are now e-mailed to the address of the logged in user (generally "admin"). This means that we now require the 'metamail' package for encoding the report as an e-mail attachment. Be warned that if you do not have it, you will not receive reports (although they will still exist in $OPENNMS_HOME/share).
